definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: E. g. I don't know how to straighten the mess out.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道该如何收拾这个烂摊子。

sentences.english: a financial train wreck between the deficit social security and medical care.
sentences.chinese: 就是社保和医保赤字的烂摊子。

sentences.english: How do we get out of this mess?
sentences.chinese: 我们如何走出这片烂摊子？

sentences.english: I'll leave this to you. Cauze I don't want to miss the party.
sentences.chinese: 我把这个烂摊子给你了，因为我不想错过舞会。

sentences.english: The kitchen was an awful mess.
Who is to blame for this mess?
sentences.chinese: 谁是这个烂摊子的始作俑者？

definition: to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave
pinyin: pai1 pai1 pi4 gu5 zou3 ren2

definition: to clear up the mess/to pick up the pieces
to deal with the aftermath (arising from an accident)/funeral arrangements/reparations
to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
to be made a scapegoat/to be unjustly blamed
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
lit. badly burned about the head (from trying to put out a fire) (idiom)/fig. hard-pressed/under pressure (from a heavy workload, creditors etc)
